website_summaries.verdict: Pricier than other brands, but high quality and comfort make it worth it.
pros: Highly water-resistant and built from durable fabric
High quality seams, stitching, and zipper
Olive drab green, so it blends in with the environment
cons: not really for anyone tall or large
Some complaints that it doesn't keep you warm if temperatures drop lower than 40 degrees Fahrenheit

customer_reviews.title: Too damn small!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on several outings now. This bag plus an ultralight bag rated for 60° F got me through a 17° night under a tarp lean to. It wasn't cozy and warm but it wasn't miserable. I was able to sleep. This wasn't a survival situation. I had access to a warmer sleeping bag, I simply didn't need it. My big gripe with this bag is that it's too short and too narrow! I'm over 6' and around 200 lb. My shoulders don't fit and the bag is so short that the hood is completely useless! This is straight up BS! THEY NEED TO MAKE A BAG FOR GROWN MEN!
customer_reviews.author: Tim W.

customer_reviews.title: and keeps you super warm. I use it with my snugpak poncho ...
customer_reviews.text: A little noisy, but is light weight, breathable, and keeps you super warm. I use it with my snugpak poncho liner and kept really warm. I don't think it would last 3-4 months on the PCT though for every night use, it says escape on it for a reason. I think it was 42 degrees F, and I kept warm all night. I have to say though, my body is like a furnace when I am sleeping, lol. This doesn't get wet inside like then normal bivvy's do. Do yourself a favor and buy this one over anything else, it is worth the gamble. Love it, and recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: DrJWCTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: I seriously recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I have the Woman's Marmot Trestles 30 bag and I knew the weather was supposed to get into the 20's on our overnight on Shortoff Mountain above Linville Gorge in NC. I'm a cold sleeper when I camp. I put it inside my bag. I admit, when I first got inside.... I was freezing. BUT when I woke up the next morning, I was toasty warm and didn't want to get out. It definitely saved my tail from hiking down that mountain in the middle of the night to the car. I seriously recommend this product. It barely weighs anything and truly did make a difference! It was 23F that night...
customer_reviews.author: Liane Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My only reason for 4 stars is the price. $20 price range would be more suiting but it does a good job at what it is intended. You won’t get overly hot with it but it pairs well with a summer weight sleeping bag for spring and fall use. I could easily roll it up and put it back in the provided carry bag and it does not weigh much. I might purchase the lite bivvy sometime for a comparison but I preferred the green color. Overall I recommend this for those who use/test the products they use for prepping. It does not replace a real sleeping bag but is a fair substitute or extra insurance on colder nights.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, and really adds warmth
customer_reviews.text: This was a good way to add some warmth to my sleep system. I always pack it, since it’s so small and light. If I get a chill in the night, I add this and warm right up. A bit constricting, as any “mummy” style sleeping bag is; you get a pretty good range of motion and your arms are reasonably free to move inside, but your legs won’t separate too far, even though you can still bend them (for those of us in a fetal position to sleep, it’s no problem). I recommend this to really anyone worried about being too cold outside.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: like a heavy mil trash bag
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I ordered one to test and inspect the quality... quickly ordered several more for our BOB's.. They are NOT a think, stretchy plastic, like a heavy mil trash bag. It appears to be like a tyvek material, very strong with a reflective surface inside. Plus, there is a zipper, like a real bag... plus, it is super light.. not sure how many ounces, but it feels real light. For something this lightweight, I was surprised at the durability and passed my tug and stretch test. Ya, I would like to see a lower price... maybe in the $30-40 range, then I would put them in all 5 cars. Overall, these are pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: I got a ton of funny looks of people walking by and the sound of ...
customer_reviews.text: Kept me warm all night when I decided to be a "survivorman" and went without a tent in a campsite full of RV's. I got a ton of funny looks of people walking by and the sound of coyotes was actually a little worrying. Regardless, despite some claustrophobia, it kept me warm throughout the night, although without a bedroll I could feel every pebble on my back. This thing is tiny and about the size of a Nalgene bottle. I wouldn't hesitate to carry this out with me in a situation where I actually would need it and not because I'm stubborn.
customer_reviews.author: Eric TungTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A must for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I took it on a camping trip to test it out, and it didnt disappoint one bit. Its durable, definitely breathable, and keeps you warm and dry. I'm glad I bought 2 of them. They are a bit pricey. I would suggest looking elsewhere, when I bought them they were $41. Seems like popularity increased the price. No bueno.
customer_reviews.author: The guy from that thing

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a summer bag alone and to boost my sleeping bag for winter use. Mine ripped along the zipper seam, but I taped it (gorilla clear tape) and that has held up so far. I actually get too hot in this in the summer nights. Really good to keep things light for summer backpacking. If you run warm like me it’s great, my sister got one and complained she was too cold.
customer_reviews.author: Cuban-B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 of these to try out for my emergency go bag. I took it camping. It's wonderful. Sturdy and durable. When it was too warm, I put my sleeping bag inside it and used it for more cushion and ground insulation. It was so nice. I was so happy I bought 6 more for my other family members. It packs away so small yet it does the job of a much bulkier bivvy. I was hauling around a military camo canvas bivvy. Not anymore. Very lightweight. I am so happy.😊
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: MAN I LOVE THIS BIVVY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: MAN I LOVE THIS BIVVY. •It’s very well made and good quality. •Plus it’s breathable. •Their is ripstop nylon around the draw string part which is nice. •It is a decent size, I’m 5’ 8” and there is plenty of space if not more. •It’s easy to pack back down it to the stuff sack. •remember this is NOT (indestructible) so treat it well, and it will last. •The OD green color it awesome. I would highly recommend getting one for your go bag, that’s what I did. Check out my YouTube vid on it My channel is -Coles outdoor vids
customer_reviews.author: Cole’s outdoor vids

customer_reviews.title: Quality survival bag with hood
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for camping, but I have decided to leave it in the car just in case I am ever stranded. The quality is outstanding! Unlike regular survival heat reflecting blankets, this one is shaped like a mummy sleeping bag with hood. Another feature that was important to me was that it is breathable so that you don't sweat and get cold from moisture while using.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Hopeful and now satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used on a trip yet, but it does seem good quality. Tried a lightweight sleeping bag with it, a bit tight but will work well. Looking forward to trying it out in the mountains soon. *******Update: Used it in a notoriously ice cold hut (it was bone jarring cold, ice on the inside of the windows) in the mountains with a light weight sleeping bag. Worked fantastic with my light weight sleeping bag and clothing layers. Part way through the evening had to take some of the layers off (back to merino s/s top, merino tights and merino socks). Next trip, no sleeping bag just the bivvy as the weather will be mild.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Ward

customer_reviews.title: Seems breathable :)
customer_reviews.text: Did some testing with the base version of the SOL emergency bivvy, and whereas it kept me warm, it also made me wet with condensation. THIS VERSION is breathable, so there didn’t seem to be a condensation issue; good! But on the other hand, it may not keep you as warm. Overall, I like it. Just know what you are getting yourself into.
customer_reviews.author: Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: If you're needing an emergency sleep solution this bivy seems perfect. The mylar space blankets are fine for a very basic scenario, but those are disposable and really loud. This, in combination with some soft of ground sheet, would make a very good emergency shelter. And the green color is especially good if you don't want to attract attention, i.e. in an urban bugout situation.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dapertutto

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I tested this at about 60 degrees in the rain. It was too small to get fully covered, settled and comfortable. Ended up tearing the thing while trying to “survive.” I wasn’t smart enough to send it back, but I am smart enough not to buy another. If you want to survive, carry a poncho liner and a full size bivy. Better yet, a sleeping bag, and stay in your car. This “survival gear” is largely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Thaddeus Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergency use
customer_reviews.text: These things are really cool for emergency use. Waterproof, plus reflective to hold the heat in. And they breathe so the moisture isn't trapped inside (although I have to take their word for it since I haven't spent a night inside it yet). It comes in a little pouch about the size of a poncho. Very light weight and easy to pack. Carry this and a large military-type poncho (doubles as rain gear and field expedient shelter) and you are covered for anything except the worst conditions. If you carrying your gear on your back and want to be prepared for an unexpected night afield, take a look at this product. Lots better than a simple space blanket
customer_reviews.author: Greg R

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I got a chance to use this this weekend for a camping trip in MN. Temps were around 34 so it was fairly wet outside, I used this as a liner for my 0 deg sleeping bag. It worked very well to keep me warm over night!. Its not as loud as the solid Mylar blankets and I didn't have any issues with condensation or moisture buildup. I would definitely take just this out on warmer nights due to its size and weight. It seems to be well built and can surely be used more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for B.O.B
customer_reviews.text: Ive slept in this in the mid 30s with just a base layer on top of a pile of leaves. This will keep you warm. Add layers if not warm enough. Its lightweight, packable and will take care of you under circumstances it was made for. I keep it in my bag just incase. Perfect for B.O.B
customer_reviews.author: Creepy Cabbage

customer_reviews.title: Seams like it will be great!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'6" 200lb and it fits me great! I'm thrilled that it's light weight and compact!! The only thing I'm not crazy about is that it's not a full zipper. It seams to go down about a third of the way. I tested the bag out inside and was so hot I got out pretty quickly. I'm excited to try it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Wanted To Love This ..
customer_reviews.text: If this had been big enough to fit a grown man, I could have truly loved this product. The color appears much darker in the pictures; I'd have preferred it to be a more solid green that would provide a bit of camouflage. The fabric itself is not bad. It's relatively quiet compared to some of the survival blankets used in the past, and if it had come up farther than the mid-chest, it may have even provided the extra warmth that was so needed. An average-sized, adult male, can not comfortably fit into this.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Liz

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: I like how small and light this packs. Worked perfect at 15,000 ft kept wind out and heat in. For 50 bucks its hard to beat a versatile sleep set up like this. Four stars because it could use a few improvements such as adding a few inches on its width/height so its not as snug around the sleeping pad/bag/clothing/body. Also, a waterproof face shield/flap would be a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: climber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent littl Bivvy Bag!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be fantastic for my Bush Craft trips into the woods. I tested it out with Military Intermediate Cold Weather bag inside. It is a little tight around the shoulders (I'm 5' 10, 240) with the bag inside. If you are using this as basic protection from the elements you do not need to fully zip it up. That gives more room to move around. I need to test without the bag, but with a poncho liner. The package is nice and small and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Dan O

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Totally surprised and impressed. Amazing job keeping warm in 27 degree F with wind chill of 14 ! Of course you do have a little bit of condensation after a full night but nothing like the original survival blankets. I especially like the drawstring hood and the zipper. Also the material can definitely last multiple uses and is much more durable than expected.
customer_reviews.author: james paladino

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I’m very cold natured and needed to find some way to stay warmer for long camping trips where temps fluctuate. I stayed in Florida and had nights that were 70 degrees and nights that were in the mid 30’s. I bought this and used it over my sleeping bag and was quite comfortable. It was so comfortable that I had to kick of my wool socks during the night (low 40’s) and that’s unheard of for me. I’m buying a second bag for my granddaughter.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne mccain

customer_reviews.title: Light but too tight
customer_reviews.text: While I like the size, weight and undercover color of this emergency bivvy, when I climbed into it it was just too tight around the arms and shoulders. I can't imagine even trying to sleep in this thing wrapped up that tightly. I'm about 5'11" with a 44 chest and a 35 waist.
customer_reviews.author: Actual User

customer_reviews.title: I went backpacking it was around 20 degrees the first ...
customer_reviews.text: I went backpacking it was around 20 degrees the first night I put my sleeping bag in the Bivvy in a Hammock and it was very hard getting in and out because past the zipper was tight so you could not have your legs bent much to get them in. the next night i put the bivvy in the bag it was a little easier to get in, both nights it keep me very warm so warm I removed my socks and got down to one layer. the sleeping bag was a 20 degree bag, but if you ever winter camp in a hammock you would understand.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Was able to go 10-15 degrees colder in my sleeping bag. Only problem is because it has a metallic reflective layer it gets cold and causes a lot of condensation even when you're not sweating. To clarify the fabric reflects your heat keeping you warmer but it is colder than the air inside so the moisture condenses on it. Still like it and will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: have not used it yet but...
customer_reviews.text: this looks like a very high quality product...it is very lightweight so do not expect this to deal with much abuse, but with care i would think this will last quite a while. Seems to be perfect materials and design all around for emergency use and definitely usable for short pack trips ...i would like to get one that was a little heavier duty and had a full length zipper and would of course be willing to pay more for it...it would be a go to regular pack item for me...SOL?
customer_reviews.author: silkyjohnson

customer_reviews.title: It feels sturdy. Probably my best bet considering my height
customer_reviews.text: 6' 2'' 210lbs. Managed to cinch the hood with a heavy down jacket on, but not while also in a zero degree sleeping bag. It feels sturdy. Probably my best bet considering my height.
customer_reviews.author: Giacomo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in my EDC bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact emergency sleeping bag for my EDC backpack. Light weight and small pack size is important for my use, zipper would be better if the bag opened all the way but smaller zipper is a weight trade off. I am 5'10 180 lbs and this bag fit well. Good choice for an emergency bag where wind and waterproofness is important
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good design, materials,large size is still to small for an average adult!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good design, materials but small even for the larger size!!! I purchased this model since it's supposed to be a larger unit than the oriiginal, but it's still to small to be used comfortably... Will give to my teenage grandson since it's still to small for an average sized adult male! Old Codger
customer_reviews.author: Debby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for emergencies or lightweight warmth, only 8.7oz
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for emergencies or lightweight warmth. The material feels similar to Tyvek, and I'm sure it will last a while if not abused. Weighs only 8.7oz with stuff sack. I like the nylon around the hood and large foot box. It fits a usgi poncho liner very well for a packable cool weather solution, or will fit a std mummy bag for extra warmth no problem. My Snugpak fit perfectly. It is very roomy for my 5'8 avg build frame. No reason not have this very packable, lightweight bivvy in your bag when unsure of weather.
customer_reviews.author: Jerz_Subbie

customer_reviews.title: A little too lightweight for me.
customer_reviews.text: Once I realized that it was made of an olefin like the Tyvex suits I wear when insulating a house, I had to return it. The purchase price was too high for me to consider keeping it as one tiny spark from a campfire would melt right through, leaving me with a leak. For someone like a hunter carrying this as an emergency bivy, the small size and light weight would be attractive features.
customer_reviews.author: Miles Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Work Well.
customer_reviews.text: It's a tad on the heavy side, but other than that, it works really well. I sleep with a quilt, not a bag, and I'm mostly outfitted for summer. But toward the end of the season, it adds considerable warmth to my arrangement, and if I am sleeping under a tarp, it adds some protection from rain. The breathability seems to work pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: It’s not SOL’s fault I’m a lardo. I weigh 260 and it ain’t going past my chest but it will work for what I need. Dimensions are as stated.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and super compact! 10/10
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t one of those cheap space blankets you find at Walmart it’s far better quality and built to take a beating. It’s made super compact and work well. Fits perfect in my bug out bag without taking barely any room. Highly recommend you buy it for your bug out bag as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the Minimalist
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a Bivi on a recent back tracking trip. My 5'9" 185lb frame fit well inside with sleeping bag. Only issue I have is that the S.O.L. Bivi only has a 1/4 length zipper on the side. You have to slide into it like a foot into a sock. Other than my face I was kept warm and dry in the Bivi from dew condensation. Well worth getting for minimalistic back packing trips.
customer_reviews.author: John Eschler

customer_reviews.title: Bought as back up light weight easy to pack used it once inside a sleeping bag ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as back up light weight easy to pack used it once inside a sleeping bag the sleeping bag with the SOL inside the bag I was toasty warm would not recommend using it with out a regular sleeping bag it would be better than a Mylar blanket in a survival situation but probably not very comfortable in cold situation
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: what a great idea
customer_reviews.text: i was skeptical about these but decided to try it out. man these really do work. and its virtually weightless! as soon as you slide into this thing you can feel the heat being reflected back at you and it doesn't feel humid at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Hartsell

customer_reviews.title: Good to throw into a day pack
customer_reviews.text: This light weight "Emergency bivvy" is a great item to throw into your pack. You may never need it, but if the occasion should ever arise, you will be glad you had it!
customer_reviews.author: W.E.A.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bivvy bag
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bivvy bag, tested in the backyard where it got to around 37-38 at the lowest. Wore baselayers, wool socks, and a beanie along with a lightweight sewn thru down quilt and pad. Kept me warm throughout the night and into the morning. I usually suffer from cold feet but I woke up nice warm and happy toes. I would give this 5 stars but had some condensation build up between my down quilt and the SOL bivvy. It was nothing too major just some light moisture. A side note, it had been raining for the past week on and off up to the night of and everything was soaking wet in the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: J Lee

customer_reviews.title: Condensation issue, zipper too short
customer_reviews.text: Has inner condensation after about 4h (conditions: 5 degrees celsius, used with thin down sleeping bag) when fully closed, than geht's very cold due to contact bridges to reflective inner coating. Not useful in combination with down sleeping bag, it gets really wet after 8h. With longer zipper on the bivvy the effect could be minimized (leave it open during begin of night when its still warm, close it before coldest period before sunrise to avoid condensation). Water resistance was not tested.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to use outdoors.
customer_reviews.text: this is cool.. like really cool!! I am upgrading my backpacking gear to be lighter, and this is the ultimate in light sleeping. The outside is water resistant (I tested it) and very durable form what I have felt and seen. The inside has the foil layer that keeps in the warmth so I'm very confident that with my 20 degree bag, air mattress, and this bivvy, I will be a happy camper. Can't wait to use it outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Part of Emergency Preparedness Kit/Pack. Used a friend's to test in mid to upper 40s. Wore base layer. Was reasonably comfortable. Note: No padding. Longer zipper would be nice but not a complaint. I'm 6'2" and 210lbs. Fit was good
customer_reviews.author: Kona Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good for a bug out bag.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and small. Maybe too small as there isn't much room inside to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Ochocojack

customer_reviews.title: good thing I had another extra blanket
customer_reviews.text: I used this when I slept in my truck during hunting trip in Oregon. I had on a socks, long John pant, sweat pant, long sleeve shirt, and a sweater. I was Cold, good thing I had another extra blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Keo1336

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'11" 160lbs. Fits perfectly outside my kelty cosmic ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'11" 160lbs. Fits perfectly outside my kelty cosmic down 20 degree bag. No more constricting than the bag itself. Purchased to combine with my tarp for a minimalist rain resistant setup.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bishop

customer_reviews.title: I can hardly believe the size, weight and warmth
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Has changed my whole thought process about sleeping systems
customer_reviews.author: D Scott Dickson

customer_reviews.title: The only complaint I have for this great product is it is not a very comfortable material ...
customer_reviews.text: no complaints as far as warmth, as it is very warm for its weight. The only complaint I have for this great product is it is not a very comfortable material but if you pair it with the sea to summit reactor not only is the escape bivy much more comfortable but also much warmer. Overall great product, and is great for me as I like hiking out to my camp sites so the light weight just makes it perfect for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: I had the lower end SOL bivvy and loved it, I haven’t tried this one yet but I already know it’ll be the best. Best quality for the price/ size and weight. At least in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Landenpk

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Everything you'd want in a survival bag. Lightweight, strong, waterproof, and most impressive is its breathable which allows you to remain dry.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Rask

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing.
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these for the off chance that I manage to strand myself when out cycling or flying out to remote areas for work. You probably won't be comfortable but it's a heck of a lot better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Batman_Bin_SuparmanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Better than you think!
customer_reviews.text: Using it as a bivvi bag for my snugpak light weight sleeping bag. Have not had it in very cold areas yet, so it can be a bit to warm in the south. Still a great light weight piece of kit. Packs small, always have it in my bug out bag.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great bivy
customer_reviews.text: Great bivy for camping, hiking or a bug out bag for emergencies. Breathable too so it won't trap moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried it yet and hope I never need to but the optimal combination of breathability (so you don't soak in your own sweat), heat retention and durability makes it great for car emergencies, backpacking mishaps and go bags.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect REUSABLE emergency bivvy.
customer_reviews.text: This is super compact. Way more durable than any of the others I have had. Been using it every night and have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Used once and happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.text: I used this recently on an overnight trip. I used the bivy with a lightweight fleece liner in about 50 degree weather. I got cold in the middle of the night but once I fully zipped up the bivvy, I was fine. I could feel the heat reflect off the inside of the hood on my neck which was impressive. My only complaint is that it is a little noisy when moving around. I am 5'6" and 150 lbs and I fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's light and seems rather durable. Not as "crinkly" as I expected. Lots of space for me, 5'10".
customer_reviews.author: Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Durable in hurricane-force winds
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Can vouch for it after having spent a night inside it in hurricane-force winds and rain. Packs down to approximately the size of a fist and is worth its weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: yonutzky

customer_reviews.title: Super light
customer_reviews.text: Love how light it is. I can pack this with my backpacking gear and not suffer for the weight. I use it as a barrier for condensation protection. I stuff my down bag in it and I don't have to worry about my bag getting wet on the tent walls from condensation.
customer_reviews.author: RickW

customer_reviews.title: Life's a garden. Dig it!
customer_reviews.text: Finally! A warm weather bivvy the size of a russet potato. Lightweight, strong and warm. A perfect liner for a 3 season system. Knocking off 1 star because zipper only goes halfway down the bag making entry and egress a tad difficult (but don't let that be a deal breaker.) Get one.
customer_reviews.author: Outlander

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but there is a better alternative.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but a little to snug. I found that the 2GoSystems Trifecta offers more room, and a few features you won't find here such as waterproof zipper that wraps around the bivy and multiple tie out points.
customer_reviews.author: Seth C.

customer_reviews.title: Product is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It's not perfectly breathable, but it's the best emergency bivy on amazon; definitely pretty expensive though
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Gerald McAfee

customer_reviews.title: Tore down some rocky debris one day but it still worked just get like a little bit of a drop cloth or piece ...
customer_reviews.text: These are worth the money , can use so many times. Eventually you will tear it but . This is my second , first I hiked from longbeach .ca to Lake Havasu . Tore down some rocky debris one day but it still worked just get like a little bit of a drop cloth or piece of cardboard under you and perfect nice drop down to like 45 degrees and I was pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality material
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy with good seams. It's NOT a sleeping bag but it is exactly what it claims, a very good bivy.
customer_reviews.author: Eman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Tried this as part of a minimalist sleep system. Worked fine, but I did get cold on an unusually cold night in the wilderness in the summer. Product is tough and light. I used it without a sleeping bag, just my clothing layers and a Sea to Summit bag liner. Still need to perfect my system, but the Escape Bivvy did the job as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would also be excellent to keep one in the car if you live ...
customer_reviews.text: No brainer. You can use it as a part of your sleep system for ultralight backpacking. Or keep it in your day pack for emergencies. Would also be excellent to keep one in the car if you live anywhere cold (if you get stuck somewhere). Better quality than I expected. Lots of great reviews on Youtube for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: GY1616

customer_reviews.title: I think it's too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I like the compact design and functionality of this product
customer_reviews.author: Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised .
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for bike packing in the sanoran desert . I used with sleeping bag liner , to reduce bulk of the sleeping bag and weight . I think I stayed warmer with the liner on top of , as opposed to in the Bivvy . It did seem a little narrow , but worked ok . It would be nice to have had a longer zipper .
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Cooke

customer_reviews.title: It Works, is light & small good gofast combo.
customer_reviews.text: It's light weight does not take up much space and a good layer to add when a summer bag is not enough or its raining under a tarp or poor shelter. I want the zipper to be longer but it's manageable nice product for its intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Ballzdeep

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly keeps you warm in decent cold weather
customer_reviews.text: This little thing surprisingly keeps you warm very quickly. I love how compact, lightweight, and breathable. You can easily place it inside a camping backpack or in a car for emergency reasons. It gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo S

customer_reviews.title: It is a great emergency bivvy that will keep you warm and out ...
customer_reviews.text: First I returned this for a very prompt refund. It is a great emergency bivvy that will keep you warm and out of the weather until help arrives, but not for the tactically minded due to noise discipline issues.
customer_reviews.author: MSteelman

customer_reviews.title: Great gear
customer_reviews.text: This product held up very well when I was homeless and sleeping on the streets, literally!!! It kept me warm enough to survive!!!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Carrion

customer_reviews.title: it works ok.
customer_reviews.text: bought to protect my down bag, moisture got trapped inside the bivy making the sleeping bag less efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: SOL Escape Bivy Performed Flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time this weekend. I am a 210 pound, 6'2" paratroop Captain There's no wasted space, but that's ok. The bag performed beautifully. I stayed warm and dry. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty durable.
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels stronger than you'd think if you care for your gear you should be able to get at least two seasons out of it. For it's lightweight and price you can't beat it as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hoe

customer_reviews.title: Great as an extra protection for a 3 season bag
customer_reviews.text: Great as an extra protection for a 3 season bag, I would not say truly waterproof. Water resistant is a better call. Overall a good lightweight addition for some extra protection from the elements. I use this as a full set up to create an ultra-lite sleeping system.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: super skinny people only
customer_reviews.text: this would be a great item for a tall skinny person. climbed into this with nothing but my pj's on and didn't have enough room to fit my arms in it. no sleeping bag or a pad. no room for that stuff . had high hopes for this item and I'm disappointed in it.
customer_reviews.author: yohna

Seems like a good product.I don't know how durable it will be until I use it.Lightweight and small.Much more expensive than a cheap space blanket but breathable and water resistant.Only a short zip which is a pity as for a few dollars more they could fit a full zip and it would fully open out into a blanket.Overall I like it and think it is a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Borocavalier

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Not the best thing by itself. Combined with the tact bivy and a good way to get from the cold of the ground it's an amazing product had it out last night with a wool blanket in less than 20 degrees F

customer_reviews.title: Good bivy for an emergency bag/ kit
customer_reviews.text: Good bivy for an emergency bag/ kit. We have 1 for each family member now. Zipper is not full length but these are durable and warm (within reason). Keep in car for winter or a bag for backpacking or emergencies. You can fit a thin liner in it too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... actually a little warm but I did not sweat like you would in an emergency
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried it in cold weather yet but I did try it at 70 degrees and it was actually a little warm but I did not sweat like you would in an emergency blanket

customer_reviews.title: it works but....
customer_reviews.text: This easily extends the use of the lighter 40degF sleeping bags to 10degF from my experience. the reason that I'm not giving it 5 stars is I'm average height 5'10" and 190lbs and this is a little short barely coming to my shoulders and is rather snug at that point.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a get home bag in warm weather
customer_reviews.text: Will work alone in warmer conditions in colder weather I use it with a mummy sleeping bag liner in my get home bag because both items can be stored compressed in my backpack unlike sleeping bags.

Reflects 70% of your body heat back to you to prevent heat loss and trap warm air
Waterproof seams and drawstring hood let's you seal out the elements

Reusable bivvy can easily be used as a sleeping bag or emergency blanket for multiple adventures
